Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Aoife1987
Reviews.Content: Very nice location with Montjuic and the Fountains across the road. Make sure you go see the Magic Fountains at night, it is brilliant. The underground is near by and not too far from the airport. Our room was nice apart from having 2 single beds put together to look like a double. But the hotel has a pool on the roof which was really refreshing after being in the heat. The breakfast buffet was nice. The bull ring shopping centre is across the road, very handy for food. The only negative is there weren't a lot of bars. The nightlife is very quiet in this area.

Reviews.Title: “The location is what recommends it”
Reviews.Author: SeeTheWorld73
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel for the location near (15 minute walk via a detour) the theatre where Les Miserables was playing. The location is very good, easy to get to and from the airport by bus or train, and right by a metro station which makes getting around the city a breeze. The room was clean enough, if not overly inviting. And I found a creepy crawly in the bathroom the morning I was leaving. Luckily I was leaving when I saw it scuttling around so I hadn't spent 4 days tiptoeing and on the lookout, as I would have if it had been the first day. In my opinion, the marble floors that cover every inch of the place are totally impractical for hotel where people occasionally want to sleep. The bathrooms, rooms, hallways...marble. Every sound, every footstep, every door opening and closing sounded like it was right in the room. There is nothing anywhere to absorb any sound. One of the reviews here had warned of that, but I still hadn't expected it to be quite that loud. The availability of a computer/internet is always appreciated when travelling, and the people working there were helpful enough if you asked them something.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay here again :o)”
Reviews.Author: RitaSquirrel
Reviews.Content: Lovely venue - esp marble bathroom, staff too: - friendly & helpful. However noisy beds and `laundry facilities' inappropriate - access to an iron would have been better. Access to the restaurant to purchase hot drinks should be made available for those not wanting/ordering breakfast (and that the provision of a kettle in the room). As there is no bar it is not a place to visit alone.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel with excellent location”
Reviews.Author: evullin
Reviews.Content: We´ve chosen this hotel because of its location and it really was a perfect decision. Metro station, Placa Espanya and Magic fountain are all just across the road, as well as the shopping centre with loads of restaurants. I espacially recommnend Dim Sum Wok restaurant where we you could eat as much as you want at a very good value compare to others. Hotel itself is nice and clean with a big bathroom a comfortable beds. But what I really mind was that you could hear every step coming from the corridors and rooms next door as there are no carpets anywhere, just tiles. Therefore you can get a good sleep only between midnight and 7am.

Reviews.Title: “A reasonable hotel with a very convenient location”
Reviews.Author: misflopes
Reviews.Content: It is a hotel on the simple side but clean. The rooms are large and in good conditions with the exception of the beds that were not comfy because the mattresses seem quite old or, at least, not in good conditions anymore. Another very unpleasant thing was the air conditioning which was very noisy. Still on the bad side, the safer of the room was broken.The internet signal was very low in the room (at the 4th floor) and the signal disappeared very frequently. It was almost useless. The street facing the hotel is quite and no noise could be heard from outside. However the acoustic isolation between rooms and between the rooms and the corridor is not good. We could hear people walking and talking in the corridors and in the room above ours. The location is very convenient: there is a main subway station less than 5 minutes walking distance from the hotel and many buses. The express bus that makes the connection to the airport also stops less than 200 m from the hotel. There are several restaurants and a very modern shopping center (converted from a bullfighting arena) just in front of the hotel. The staff is kind and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: travelingsenior
Reviews.Content: I wanted a place that was safe to walk, yet was reasonably close to shopping, as my elderly mother and I were travelling together. Since this was my first time to Barcelona, we took a cab from the airport to the hotel. For 2 of us, it cost us around 24 euros. The hotel is in an excellent location; close to many reasonable priced restaurants, close to metro stations and airport buses and close to the Barcelona Tour bus stop. During the day, we did the Barcelona tourist bus and at night, we watched the beautiful fountain, a very short walk from the hotel. We did not pay for the hotel breakfast as we knew we couldn't eat that much. Instead, we went to the basement of the shopping mall (converted from a bullfighting arena) and enjoyed crepes, gelato and pastries. There are many places to eat near the hotel and the food was good and reasonably priced. There were only a few bad things: One was that our flight into Barcelona was so early that the hotel couldn't check in early However, the hotel had a place for us to store our bags. Also, I could hear the clicking of the shoe heels from the floor above us in the morning. Also, internet access in the room was very faint, however, I didn't want to go to the lobby to access the internet and was able to do a few non-network intensive work from my computer. Access to and from the airport, on the L1 was very reasonable (5.30 euros) and fast.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Fira Solid 3Stars”
Reviews.Author: FalWetVet
Reviews.Content: No more than an 8 minute walk to the Fira at the foot of Montijuic, hotel is average in a good location. Clean, very comfortable king bed and a bath which in size could be deemed lavish by Euro standards. Surprise is the charming rooftop pool and sitting area. Breakfast provided ample options. Plenty of restaurants right on the next block plus the new Las Arenas which is an old brick bull ring made into a smashing multi level mall. Very cool & popular. Parc de Joan Miro right across the street is a nice as well. Metro & buses right at the corner as is bike rental (great intra city system). Sans Train station an easy 12 minute walk. For our purposes (a convention) hotel was fine, location terrific - only concern front desk advised NOT to use hotel safes for they are "very old & unreliable" but stated hotel was safe which it was.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, uncomfortable beds, poor service!”
Reviews.Author: bosa1975
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in a very convenient area and is only steps away from the airport shuttles. The hotel room was large enough to have us as a family. The beds were not comfortable at all. We could listen the springs making noise everytime we turn in bed. The breakfast was decent. There weren't so many food to choose. We felt kind of embarressed when the waiter serving us complained about leftovers after breakfast.Later on we were more careful about our eating manners cause we thought the guy could be even meaner. So as a location this hotel deserves 5 stars on the other hand they have to make some changes about the service as well as their beds.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay and service”
Reviews.Author: Manuzz
Reviews.Content: Very good position, close to Plaza de Espana and to the metro. Good rooms and service, passable breakfast. Small pool but nice to have it when coming back late. wi-fi weak in the room, but 2 computers available in public room. Only concern is the parking place, garage not good, too narrow passageway even for medium sized car, also too expensive. Fair price.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. I'll be back if I am in the city again.”
Reviews.Author: altafrahman
Reviews.Content: My university paid for the 4 night staying - so I wont comment on the pricing. I just loved the location. Very close from the Barcelona Sant train station. And Plaça Espanya Metro is 3 minute walkin distance. There is a huge mall nearby - Arenas de Barcelona (it helped me to get done with shopping at the last moment). And it is also close to the Magic Fountain, Pueblo Espanol and Parc de Joan Miró. The room had modern furniture and clean. Fast wifi internet. I was very satisfied. One thing - Breakfast was not upto the mark. It costs 7+ extra. So I would suggest to get something else outside instead.

Reviews.Title: “Plaça d'Espanya Rules”
Reviews.Author: harald_haugli
Reviews.Content: This good hotel is very reasonably priced for Barcelona, and is very close to Plaça d'Espanya. This grand square is absolutely my favorite in this city, and so much more impressive than other overrated squares. Yes, there has been lots of construction work going on around here lately, you can hardly blame the hotel for that, and I cannot believe the bad reviews that are so different from my experience. I had a balcony directly out into the street and was never bothered. When some people obviously has so sensitive ears, why not bring ear-plugs on your holiday then? Location is also good for all kinds of public transport, including the main train station which is within walking distance. The pleasant Parc Joan Miró is next door.

Reviews.Title: “good location, terrible breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Rioja00
Reviews.Content: The reception staff speaks English which is not a standard in Spain. Room 416 (a triple) was big, with a park view and a balcony. At all cost avoid breakfast in this hotel. It costs almost 8 Euro per person and is really terrible. For that kind of money (or less) you can eat good breakfast in bars nearby (Tapa Tapa or small bar just around the corner, next to the park). We recommend lunch in a restaurant opposite the hotel (Tapas Gaudi).

Reviews.Title: “Near everything”
Reviews.Author: LisaAlmeidaMelo
Reviews.Content: Breakfast was good , from 7 to 10 am, had all the food you needed to start a day, might have lacked a bit in variety but still pretty good. Rooms were all very clean and comfortable , although I think that the ones with the street view are better than the ones that look to the back of the hotel. The location was perfect, the new Arena of Barcelona opened about 10 days before I went to Barcelona, so the area now has a huge mall, located in one of Barcelonas main plazas, the Plaza of Spain. ´ You have access to dozens of bus lines , 3 metro lines , and most importantly the bus 46, that takes you directly to the airport and from the airport, stops in that plaza. You have loads of restaurants right in front of the hotel, you have loads of stores right in front of the hotel and you are also very near of montjuic , and also very near of a park that has a miro's sculpture. For the price, Onix Fira just couldn't be better , well located, clean, nice breakfast, and also very good services. The hotel is small , but that is as bad as it is good, since it isn't a crowded hotel , services tend to be better.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: LauraB2507
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for five nights. The hotel was clean and the room looked like an average 3 star hotel room. We opted not to have breakfast- it cost 15 euros. We ate breakfast- coffee and croissant- at cafe across the road. It cost 6 euros for two people. The hotel is in a good location, near to the metro station , Joan Miro Park,and the olympic stadiums. Most attractions could be reached on metro within 10 minutes. The metro was a cheap and easy way to travel. There was a tv and hairdryer in the room but when we asked for the safety deposit box (Located in the wardrobe), the receptionist told us they were not really safe, so we used our suitcase locks to lock our valuables away. Mini bar in room had reasonable prices.The pool was an added bonus, very small but great for a city break. Would go back here, the hotel met our needs and was clean, but nothing outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Too noisy, forget about getting any sleep!”
Reviews.Author: Langly
Reviews.Content: I had read that the hotel was near a construction site, and sadly enough, it's true. But I was happy when I found out that my room was not facing teh construction site, because I really wanted to sleep in on saturday morning. Unfortunately, the cleaning ladies had a different idea. At 8 am, they started moving furniture around, making A LOT of noise. I even used earplugs, but no avail, they were really into making noise. I complaint, but on sunday morning, at 8:30 am, they started playing the same "music". I can't understand why you need to be so disrespectful to the guests trying to rest. They also charger me for two breakfasts that I hadn't eaten. On the other hand, the hotel is well located (although due to the constuction you have a good 10 minute walk to the metro), it's really clean, has free internet and the rooms and bathrooms are okay.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel website is full of false advertising”
Reviews.Author: Josie0007
Reviews.Content: I found a good deal via Travel Zoo that I booked on the Onix Fira hotel website which said we'd have our choice of either a queen or a king (we opted for king when I booked on the Onix Fira website) and a 'relaxation kit' with 'bath salts and more'. All sounded very lovely and we were looking forward to our long weekend in Barcelona. We arrived at the hotel where to our surprise we were given a small twin bed room. No sign of any 'relaxation kit' with the closest thing being the token tiny bottles of shampoo/bodywash that you often get at hotels plus a couple of little sachets of moisturiser. Certainly no bath salts! We went downstairs to say perhaps there had been a mix up and we were given the wrong room. We were told that no - there are no king beds at all at Onix Fira (despite their hotel online booking forms saying clearly either queen or king size beds and no mention of twin beds). We were told that out of 80 beds there are only 5 queens...and even though I booked months in advance, had checked 'king' on their website, and then personally requested a king in the comments and had the booking confirmed by them we were still given a twin room. I have just checked the Onix Fira hotel website and it still says they have rooms with two beds, or 'king size' beds. I suggest thinking single bed where it says queen (as there is no way 2 people could sleep in one of the beds we had), and queen where it says king size. We were told the 'relaxation kit' was just for marketing and was in the bathroom already. He was pleasant enough, but did not do anything. I will complain about the false advertising with Travel Zoo and would not recommend booking any deals you come across through them. It is a pity this tainted our initial view of the hotel and of Barcelona. The location is good - an easy walk from Barcelona Sants train station, which is a 25 min train from the airport and nearby to Placa d'espanya so easy to metro around the place. Yes, the surroundings are like staying in a construction site. You need to walk in the wrong direction to be able to cross the street and get where you want to be, but other than a bit of inconvenience it wasn't a problem. There was no construction noise in the evenings although they did work Saturday, but we were up and about anyway. We did get woken by people returning to their rooms in the wee hours as it is tile flooring only so very noisy - as well as woken by rooms being cleaned first thing in the morning and chairs/beds being moved around scraping on the flooring. It's an easy 10 minute walk to the Magic Fountain which is well worth a visit or 2. The room was clean, but there was a lot of wear and tear. Lots of scuff marks on the walls and wear and tear in the bathroom. The decor is very dated with cheap polyester bed covers. Upsides - the shower is very good, and the buffet breakfast was plentiful and had a lot of choice plus differed slightly day-to-day. If a twin room had been what we were expecting then it would have been adequate and comfortable enough but instead we got blatant false advertising and were left feeling disappointed and ripped off.

Reviews.Title: “Like staying on a constructionsite”
Reviews.Author: bigbigblue
Reviews.Content: One would think that the hotel would really appriciated the fact that travellers who are taking the effort to pass the muddy constructionsite (next to Onix Fiera already for years they are reshaping an arena to a shopping-mall) to help this hotel through those difficult times. But no. The nextdoor work-in-progress gives quite some noise, the beds lost during the past years their softness and the staff is not flexible enough to privide a cup of breakfast coffee on a Sundaymorning (breakfast till 10.00) to the guest who overslept and enters the breakfastroom at 10.05... Poor hospitality, next time to the neighbours: B Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “got ripped off badly!! extra 260 euro :/”
Reviews.Author: onegina1
Reviews.Content: On the last day of stay and particularly when leaving it, the receptionist has incurred an extremely high price for minibar use. Each day we used couple of beer, water and chocolate, which would make it in total 17 euro maximum per day. However, when the receptionist provided a bill for used stuff in a minibar, it was obvious that he just overcharged us badly. I felt as a silly tourist, willing to fight for my money though. One thing, the flight was about to commence in 1.5 h, that's why we didn't have much time to argue. Eventually, we were forced to pay 260 euro after staying in hotel for 8 days. Such a shame on them, I'm going to write a letter to a general manager or CEO and claim a part of my money back.

Reviews.Title: “Price right for location”
Reviews.Author: Net0
Reviews.Content: Just one block from Plaza Espanya (underground station) and just 2 stations from the Train Station Barcelona Sants, from airport there is a bus that crosses just in the corner. From the train station I suggest walking (less than 10 min) instead of the underground; is better if you are carrying luggage because the underground doesn’t have electric stairs or elevator. Rooms are spacious and clean with a big bathroom. The breakfast is not included on the rate but don’t eat there is not good and expensive (considering what you eat) there is a computer desktop and is free to use internet. Good option for the price you can start your tour from the city at the Plaza Espanya, the Montjuic hill, sightseeing’s are located in the same area and just 4 stations from the Camp Nou Barcelona Soccer Staduim …. Downtown is via underground

Reviews.Title: “This hotel served our needs”
Reviews.Author: RonJohn777
Reviews.Content: The hotel is one block from Placa Espanya, with connections to everywhere. It was an extremely good value; the excellent rate includes breakfast and free parking underground (which we didn't use -- we used public transportation). The area is safe and quiet. Hotel was a bit hard to get into due to construction across the street (maybe this is why the rate was so good?), but this was a minor drawback. Breakfast was plentiful and excellent. Meats, cheeses, scrambled eggs, breakfast sausages, toast, pastries, etc. We would happily stay here again if we return to Barcelona. Also, there are two computers with free access.

Reviews.Title: “Large but basic accommodation in a central location”
Reviews.Author: Anne-Louise_26
Reviews.Content: I would definitely recommend this hotel. The rooms were all very large but well equipped with high quality furnishings and the same can also be said for the communal areas. The level of cleanliness and attentiveness of staff were both great. My only criticism would be that the breakfast selection was very limited although adequate. The hotel is located minutes from a Metro station and the airport shuttle bus, and is also within walking distance of many attractions. It is also near a supermarket and in an area where it feels very safe to walk around at night. The hotel is set back slightly from the road and so is also quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad”
Reviews.Author: gummibaerli
Reviews.Content: Great location, next to Fira Barcelona (congress) and Plaça de Espana (aerobus, metro L5 und L1) Big and clean rooms, huge bathroom with marmor. Very bad Wi-Fi connection (at least on th 5th floor), Relatively quiet. Convenient place to stay for business trip. Not sure for holliday.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely rude staff and got robbed-be extra cautious”
Reviews.Author: Jacob_Tharian
Reviews.Content: We were staying at this hotel for 2 nights,arrived late from Nice,France .The hotel is centrally located but on a narrow street behind a big stadium that was under construction. The rooms were clean and basic. everything seemed OK . I asked about using the safe in the room the next day and the person at the counter said it costs 6 Euros a day and that the rooms are safe(my mistake to believe him) On the second day we went out leaving a good deal of money and our passports at the hotel .we locked one of the wardrobes and hid the key. we were out for about 3 hours for dinner and sightseeing , came back slept .The next morning we were leaving for Madrid, we found that except for a few notes of smaller denomination all our money was taken . As if that was not bad. we quickly went down to complain and the receptionist scratched his head and said it was very strange. (yea we knew that!!!), He kept telling us to check and make sure we didn't keep the money somewhere else !!apparently it has happened before !!and he said we have to go to the station to make a report but unfortunately we had a train to catch in an hours time. They did not even offer to take a note of this complaint. we were in a hurry so couldn't pursue the case. It must have been an inside job.so whoever is booking this hotel please be very very careful with whatever you leave in the room .Hope no one else has such a bad experience.

Reviews.Title: “Worth for its money”
Reviews.Author: Julian-Iliev
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in good place, have good parking but it cost 17 euro - must be free. The rooms are good, quiet and clear, but the view is not good, the backyard. Big bathroom !!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice rooms, priced right”
Reviews.Author: travelalot04
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights over the Memorial Day weekend. Located next to Plaça d'Espanya and very convenient bus and subway stops. Had a beautiful park view room, however, there happened to be an open air concert (Sat & Sun) in the park that got loud at times. Our room was spacious and clean, but the furniture was a little worn out. Didn't get a chance to utilize the (tiny) rooftop pool or solarium. The staff was friendly and helpful. The breakfast was better than average compared to other European countries.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel. great location”
Reviews.Author: rojojaal
Reviews.Content: this hotel is great value for anyone looking to spend some leisure time in barcelona. the hotel is very close to the Espanya metro station and just round the corner from one of the drop offs on the Aerobus route from the airport. the hotel is very clean and welcoming. the staff are friendly and can speak some english and are helpful. the rooms are a good size (we had a double.). we went for the one with a balcony view of the park which was nice. the park is used by dog walkers so some barking can be heard but it is not a real put off. the balcony is large enough (just)for two to sit and enjoy a glass of rioja. the bathroom is a good size with good water pressure and plenty of hot water. the breakfast is good quality and worth the 7 euros. you can also choose which days you want it if you have not prepaid for it, so can miss it if you dont feel like it. all in all a good hotel and great location for those on a budget. swimming pool is a plunge pool really, but its great as is the rooftop terrace surrouding it.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for a good value”
Reviews.Author: Qbasa
Reviews.Content: We've spent 4 nights in Onix Fira hotel in Barcelona. That's a very nice, though quite basic hotel. It's located not far from city centre - 45 min by foot or couple of minutes by subway. Rooms are basic, yet cosy, toilets are very clean. Our room was equipped with digital lcd, hair dryer, mini bar, shower+ tub. There's everything one traveller needs during stay in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “ok, basic hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: saymyname
Reviews.Content: basic hotel, relatively clean (they change towels each day), great location (near metro and cca 20 min of walk toward La Rambla), good value for money... Plaza de Espanya (with famous fountains) is almost next to the hotel... dont know what the food is like tiny walls and the building in front of the hotel is really close, so you dont get the best view, but what you pay is what you get- anyway, would recommend it if you dont want to spend a lot of money on hotels

Reviews.Title: “Small avarage rooms”
Reviews.Author: mptranslations
Reviews.Content: We booked a triple room so they had put an extra bed in a double room which meant that the room was stuffed with beds. No where to sit down besides on the beds. The blankets they put on top of the sheets where well used! The balcony was extremly small about 1,5 m2. The outdoor pool was closed the week before we arrived. A shame that they did not say so on their homepage as it was one of the reasons we booked it. Fortunately they were very friendly and let us check out two days early so that we could get another hotel. I would recommend the hotel to Interrailers or people on a tight budget.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely location, great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: indianguy
Reviews.Content: The location very close to Plaza Espanya and the metro station makes it perfect for exploring the city using the metro system. Because of reconstruction work on the Arena de Barcelona, the hotel has become a little difficult to reach by car when going there for the first time using GPS. The garage is adequate and safe (Euro 15 per day) for leaving the car. The entry and exit ramps are narrow and one needs to be careful when turning. The breakfast is absolutely fantastic with cold cuts, pastries, different breads, milk, tea, coffee, cornflakes, fruits and juices. Fresh and delicious. Staff were friendly and helpful. I had called the hotel a day before reaching and they had assured about late check-in and availabilty of parking space in the garage, both assurances were kept. Room was clean, the bathroom was big, hot water was available at all times. Towels in the bathroom and linen on the beds were replaced daily. The view from the balcony over the park and Tibidabo in the far distance was very nice. Overall, a great experience. Nothing that disturbed or marred the overall experience.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: patmoran3
Reviews.Content: Stayed 1 night precruise in a standard room. Got a great rate through booking.com which made location issues secondary. Used metro to get around which work well once we got our bearings. Room was small with a large comfortable bed. Bathroom was large. Breakfast was good and was included in our rate. Staff was very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: ValentinYosifov
Reviews.Content: Onix Fira is a nice hotel with very good service and excellent location. Me and my wife are very satisfied Because of the service and also the low Which special price we paid for it.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: Jasminroberts
Reviews.Content: Stayed with 2 other friends. The triple room was huge and spacious, and the bathroom was huge as well, with a shower and bathtub. Free internet on the second floor, only 2 terminals so you can use it as long as nobody else is. Friendly staff at front desk. The lifts sound very wonky and scary though, but didnt break down thankfully. Very good location, 5 minutes walk to the metro station and 10 minutes walk to a train station. There are also many cafes around the area to choose from, with decently priced food. 2 minutes from the hotel, there is a supermarket that opens till quite late. I felt generally safe walking around the hotel at night.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION AND PRICE”
Reviews.Author: mackemsol
Reviews.Content: I am quite familiar with many hotels in BCN from the hostel style to 4 star luxury. This is the first time I stayed at this hotel. It is in an excellent location just a five minute stroll from the AeroBus stop and Metro in Plaza Espana. It took just 5 minutes to check-in and receive my room key card. The hotel is clean and spacious. Rooms have a/c; the bathroom has a full sized bath and shower. My room was at the side of the hotel overlooking a park. The price [€60 per night for a double room] included breakfast which was varied and substantial. The staff were extremely helpful. I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for somewhere central at a very good price.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, good service, frendly staff!!!”
Reviews.Author: Scarlett27
Reviews.Content: Excellent location just minutes from the Fira (exhibition center). Really great !!! The hotel is only a minute walk from Plaza Espanya, about 250 meters,which is not only located in the center of the city but is one of the places where the aeroport bus stops !!!! and is only two metro stops from the Sants railway station where the airport train stops. The hotel is very nice and clean and the staff is very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: well_9
Reviews.Content: Not the level of comfort nor service I expect from a 4-star hotel. Very basic rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Very Basic”
Reviews.Author: NatDublin
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Onix Fira with my boyfriend for a long weekend, the room was clean but very very basic, so its Ok i guess for a place to crash after a full day out. We were meant to have a double bed, but it was actually two single beds put together. There was free internet access all the time in the reception and it is 3 metro stops away from Place de Catalunya which is the city centre. On their website it says that there is a small rooftop swimming pool, but saying small its an exageration, its the size of an avarage bath tub. Our room was on the first floor, about 50 metres from the old Bull Arena, which was under construction so a lot of noise ! there s a tiny balcony but obviously not a nice view, just buildings and traffic. The staff didn't go any extra miles to make you feel welcome so alltogether very very basic. I d love to go back to Barcelona, if i do, i ll defenetly look for another hotel, as for €400 for 3 nights we might find something cosier ...
